WASHINGTON - Former Cambridge Analytica employee and whistleblower Chris Wylie is testifying before the Senate Judiciary Committee at 10a.m.

Wylie first became a household name after revealing that Cambridge Analytica obtained information from 50 million Facebook users, using it to build psychological profiles so voters could be targeted with ads and stories.
(FILES) In this file photo taken on November 21, 2016 Facebook logos are pictured on the screens of a smartphone (R), and a laptop computer, in central London on November 21, 2016.
A subsidiary of Strategic Communications Laboratories (SCL), Cambridge Analytica (CA) has offices in New York, Washington and London and is directed by Alexander Nix.
Cambridge Analytica is a private company for strategic communication and data analysis at the heart of a scandal over the use of personal data collected on Facebook.
It also denied any wrongdoing over the Facebook data it acquired from Cambridge University psychology professor Alex Kogan.
Cambridge Analytica denied that it or any of its affiliates "use entrapment, bribes or so-called honey-traps."
